intro: Argentina anserinoides, commonly known as the Argentine anserina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and shrublands, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow. Argentina anserinoides is often used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory properties.
